title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 61.1 - Sale of beer in bulk
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 61.1 - Sale of beer in bulk

State Regulations
A licensed brewer may sell beer at retail in bulk by the
keg, cask or barrel for consumption and not for resale at a clambake, barbecue, picnic, outing, or other similar outdoor gathering upon the following
conditions: (a) Permission must first
be obtained from the authority by the filing of a duly verified
application. (b) More than 50
persons must be assembled at such clambake, barbecue, picnic, outing or other
similar outdoor gathering. (c) No
admission fee may be charged or other thing of value be given for admission to
such gathering. (d) The beer may
not be resold but is to be given away to persons attending the
gathering. (e) No beer may be taken
off the premises where the gathering is held, except that at the termination of
the gathering, any beer which shall remain on hand will be removed from
premises by the brewer or its designated agent. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
61.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
